measure.name: add_os_water_heater_mixed_tankless_electric
measure.description: This measure adds an OS:WaterHeater:Mixed object representing an Electric Tankless Water Heater. Users will be asked to provide 6 inputs: 1) Plant Loop Assignment; 2)Rated Energy Factor; 3) SHW Setpoint; 4) Water Heater Capacity; 5) Water Heater Location; 6) Derate for cycling inefficiencies
measure.modeler_description: The measure will create a new instance of the OS:WaterHeater:Mixed object. The measure will either create a new plant loop, or be assigned to an existing plant loop. The object will be configured be to use the user arguments. The EIO file (generated upon sucessful simulation) can be viewed to compare the industry standard ratings of Recovery Efficiency and Energy Factor for water heater objects as compared to the user input values for these ratings. Tankless water heaters are assumed to have 1 gallon of storage (0.00379 m^3).

argument.name: existing_plant_loop_name
argument.display_name: Plant Loop to assign Water heater as a Supply Equipment

argument.name: rated_energy_factor
argument.display_name: Rated Energy Factor of Electric Tankless Water Heater. This field is ignored for NCTH and B10 protocols.

argument.name: water_heater_location
argument.display_name: Thermal Zone where the Electric Tankless Water Heater is located

argument.name: water_heater_capacity
argument.display_name: The nominal capacity [kW] of the electric storage water heater. Set to 0 to have this field autosized.

argument.name: derate_for_cycling_inefficiencies
argument.display_name: Annual Energy Derate for Cycling Inefficiencies - this factor accounts for the small water draws on the heat exchanger that are not currently reflected in the DOE Energy Factor test procedure. CEC 2008 Title 24 implemented an 8% derate for tankless water heaters.
